title: Markers for Tippy
description: Cairns are traditionally made of a mound of rough stones built as a memorial or property or landmark. The bowling ball cairns in Markers for Tippy are arranged in pyramids that mimic the common organization of bowling pins and deny the ballsâ€™ typical dynamic function. The pattern established by the piles is defied by the partially sunken cairn and the ball that appears to deny gravity. I associate bowling to my blue-collar background; my father was an avid and skilled bowler. His nickname was Tippy.
